channel.title: Comments on: Scaling Neo4j with Cache Sharding and Neo4j HA

item.title: By: Performance in Neo4j (“Obligatory Neo4j” Part 4) | alex.d.garland
item.dc:creator: Performance in Neo4j (“Obligatory Neo4j” Part 4) | alex.d.garland
item.description: […] There are also some architectural and hardware-based options. The commercially licensed version of Neo4j offers the possibility of master-slave replication for horizontal read-scaling, and a technique called cache-sharding can be used which increases the chance of required data being queued up in main memory. There are more details on that here. […]
item.content:encoded: […] There are also some architectural and hardware-based options.  The commercially licensed version of Neo4j offers the possibility of master-slave replication for horizontal read-scaling, and a technique called cache-sharding can be used which increases the chance of required data being queued up in main memory.  There are more details on that here. […]
